creator: mats.bauer@daimlerchrysler.com
text:
hi there

i tried a few things getting started with fop and xsl:fo.
i ran into a suspicous behaviour when using a table.
after rendering the second part of my table looks like 
(rightmost columns omitted)
-----
  LN:-12345678------------------
 |         |brown   fox jumps  o
 |         |jumps  over  the laz
 |         |the lazy dog.  A qui
 |         |                    
 |         |dog.  A quick  brown
 |         |quick  brown  fox ju
 |         |                    
            brown   fox jumps  o
  |1.00     |B 910351521001     
                                
  |         |ENTGRATRWERKZEUG   
  |         |HARTSTOFFBE-SCHICHT
                                
  |         |Farbe  mit leerer  

-----

if somebody could tell me if this is a bug in fop or a bug in 
my stylesheet i would greatly appreciate any comments.

Created attachment 244
xsl:fo stylesheet with suspicious table for reproducing the 'bug'
creator: mats.bauer@daimlerchrysler.com
klease@club-internet.fr
text:
Using today's (6 Aug. 2001) CVS version of FOP, the attached fo file looks
normal to me. This is probably yet another table bug which has been fixed by the
latest changes.

creator: gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition to closed remaining pre-FOP1.0 resolved bugs
